intro: Tapinopentas latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved tapinopentas, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
